description: Monique Weimer, 31, of Vicksburg, turned herself at the Warren County Sheriffs Department, Sheriff Martin Pace said. Myesha Wills, 30, of Arlington, Texas, surrendered Thursday at the sheriffs office, Pace said. Wills was released from custody after posting $250,000 bail, Pace said.
text:
Two arrests have been made after video that appears to show a vulnerable woman
being abused surfaced on social media, authorities said.

Monique Weimer, 31, of Vicksburg, turned herself at the Warren County Sheriffs
Department, Sheriff Martin Pace said.

She is charged with accessory before the fact to inflicting physical pain or
injury on a vulnerable person.

Myesha Wills, 30, of Arlington, Texas, surrendered Thursday at the sheriffs
office, Pace said.

Wills and her attorney discussed the allegations against her with
investigators and watched the video, which showed the apparent abuse of Wills
relative, Pace said.

Wills was arrested and charged with felonious infliction of physical pain or
injury on a vulnerable person.

Wills was released from custody after posting $250,000 bail, Pace said.

Weimer is jailed on a $50,000 bond, Pace said.

This is a sad case and unfortunate case and is an ongoing investigation, Pace
said.

At this point, I cant rule out more charges or additional arrests.

title: 2 people held in custody in connection to beating video case in Warren County [Legal Monitor Worldwide]
html:
Two arrests have been made after video that appears to show a vulnerable woman being abused surfaced on social media, authorities said.

Monique Weimer, 31, of Vicksburg, turned herself at the Warren County Sheriffs Department, Sheriff Martin Pace said.

She is charged with accessory before the fact to inflicting physical pain or injury on a vulnerable person.

Myesha Wills, 30, of Arlington, Texas, surrendered Thursday at the sheriffs office, Pace said.

Wills and her attorney discussed the allegations against her with investigators and watched the video, which showed the apparent abuse of Wills relative, Pace said.

Wills was arrested and charged with felonious infliction of physical pain or injury on a vulnerable person.

Wills was released from custody after posting $250,000 bail, Pace said.

Weimer is jailed on a $50,000 bond, Pace said.

This is a sad case and unfortunate case and is an ongoing investigation, Pace said.

At this point, I cant rule out more charges or additional arrests.
